meanings.definition: A disease affecting the foot of a horse, characterized by inflammation and suppuration of the hoof.
meanings.sent1: The vet diagnosed the horse with quittor after noticing signs of hoof inflammation.
meanings.sent2: The quittor caused the horse discomfort and difficulty in walking.
meanings.sent3: The horse with quittor tried to wear tiny shoes to protect its hooves, but they kept falling off.
meanings.sent4: The quittor spread through the stable like wildfire, affecting multiple horses.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the quittor infection was unmistakable, lingering in the air.

meanings.definition: To quit; to give up; to resign.
meanings.sent1: Feeling overwhelmed, he decided to quittor his job and pursue a different career path.
meanings.sent2: She chose to quittor her bad habits and start leading a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to quittor procrastination, but it kept creeping back into his routine.
meanings.sent4: After years of dedication, he finally decided to quittor his role as team captain.
meanings.sent5: The decision to quittor the project was not easy, but it was necessary for his well-being.
